title: Old, but has its charms
text:
First stop on a China business trip and stayed all at Hyatt Hotels - Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen.
This was the oldest of the hotels, rooms and interiors looked a bit dated, but they have spent a great deal refurbishing them as best as can be done.
I stayed in a Club room with access to Club Lounge and even though they had native English, German and Russian speakers working, the Chinese staff had excellent English and knew how to small talk with the guests. Service was excellent as well!
Beijing is a bit of a sprawl of a city and the hotel is located within a giant mall and office complex so there is plenty of stuff within an easy walk from the hotel (and you need not even go outside if pollution is a concern).
Will definitely stay here again next time I'm in Beijing.
Room Tip: Be sure to check out the underground tropical pool and fitness area! See more room tips
